properties.text: The mob difficulty in this pack is programmed to scale up drastically as you play.  This will give you a short period of time to set up a base and protect it.  This should be a top priority in your first 3 days, as being unprepared for your first Blood Moon will likely result in you AND your base being destroyed.
Mobs are much smarter in this pack.  They can carry dynamite to blow up your walls, stack blocks to reach you up high, and dig if you try to hide your base underground.
Whether it's defending your base, or fighting through a Doomlike Dungeon, combat is going to be a daily occurrence.  Craft Of The Titans approaches

combat with a different style than most modpacks.  Usually the mobs are overtuned, and you spend the entire game fearing for your life.  Or you are too powerful, and the combat becomes a boring button mash.  In Craft Of The Titans, both you AND the foes you face will become powerful forces to be

reckoned with.  GONE are the days where one mod had all the best weapons, so you were stuck using the same ol' staff or bow in the end game (lookin at you Draconic Evo).  In CoTT weapons from multiple different mods have all been tweaked to be strong and viable end game options.
So if you want to swing a huge Battleaxe and Shield, or duel wield a pair of wild west Revolvers, you

can, without sacrificing power.  Fight how YOU want to fight... not locked into any one mod.  In fact, its encouraged that you keep a few options available.  You may run into a heavily armored opponent, who requires the armor piercing bullets of your revolver, before switching to an overbuffed Tinker's Scythe to AOE down his minions.  Combat is FUN in CoTT, and the options are endless.
In addition to weaponry, there are combat and inventory pets to aid you.  Train your own Combat Bat to fly around striking at your foes, levelling up, and becoming stronger.

expanding your empire.  There are hundreds of people who are counting on your Care Packages back home.  Families need the crops and meals you produce.  Scientists need the samples and mob drops you find.  Even the military has commissioned you to provide chemical fluids from your excavations.
In exchange for your care packages and supplies.  Your homeland security team will send you Titan Runes, which you can trade for powerful items and crafting materials.

We all love automation, big farms, mob grinders, quarries, etc...  But with most modpacks, it seems that by the time you have the resources to build all of those things, it's not long before you stop needing all of those things.
No more getting bored because you have accrued so much Minecraft Wealth that you don't feel the need to continue

Some of the Titans in this modpack will require you to think outside of the box.  You can not just brute force your way through every fight.  What will you do when you come up against a Guardian that reduces all damage by 90%... or heals from physical damage?  
     This modpack gives you tons of tools... use them.  If that means summoning the boss in to an arena lined with Turrets... do it.  If that means learning powerful Ars Magica spells that inflict unique "Drowning" damage.  Do it.  There is always a key to each fight.

Welcome to the Craft Of The Titans.  You have been tasked with exploring a vast and dangerous land, plundering it's resources to send back to your homeland, and conquering the rumored Titans that stand in your path.            
      You will need to make use of all of the powerful tools at your disposal, as your foes will pull no punches.
This is a Hybrid Quest modpack. There are quests that will outline your progression through different aspects of the game.  But they will not hold your hand through every little step.
You can press Grave " ` " (by default) to open your Better Questing Interface. Be sure to check quests frequenly before crafting new items.

This Reference Manual is here to explain some of the many unique aspects of this Modpack.  Recipe changes, gear tweaks, and progression paths have all been customized. If you find yourself stuck, check here for tips.
"This pack will put you through the paces.  There is alot of combat early on, as you get established, and time is of the essence.
Titan runes are relics that you find in dungeons, or as rewards for sending large Care Packages back to your homeland.
Some Titan Runs have inherent energy within them, that makes them the catalyst for some crafting recipes, while others seem dormant, good for trade.

The biggest focus of this pack is exploration.  You MUST go dungeon crawling, treasure hunting, spelunking, cave diving, and mining.  There are no early game quarries, there are no shortcuts for rare materials.  The custom tweaked terrain generation, dungeon system, and loot generation will make every expedition unique and exciting.

This pack has been heavily modified to provide a challenging and rewarding experience.  DO NOT ASSUME any aspect of the mods in this pack is the same as you have played in other packs.  You might have been able to fly with a certain armor set in previous packs... but you cant in this pack.  A certain generator might not have given much power in another pack... but gives lots of power in this pack.  Mobs might have dropped something in other packs, but drop something different in this pack.  Approach the mods in this pack as though they were new to you.  They might be.

Power is progressive in this pack.  Meaning, the further you get, the more access to rare materials you will have.  If a recipe calls for a material you don't have, it may be in a dimension you haven't been to yet.
Onyx is a rare material found only in the Nether.  When molten it becomes stronger, making it the top tier material for Tinker's Construct.
Lava Crystals very rarely spawn at low depths in the Overworld, but are very common in the Nether

Anglesite and Benitoite are energy crystals that can only be found in the distant Dimension "The Beneath".  They are commonly used in the construction of power sources such as Reactors, and even some trinkets which can harness their inherent energy.

Sunstone Ore is often found in and below large pools of Lava, both in the large pits you find in the Overworld, and  of course The Nether.  You will want to pop a Fire Resist potion, then go diving in the Lava pools with a decent pickaxe.

You will  notice that some recipes require the inherent energy inside of these Titan Energy Runes.   The majority of these runes have been horded by the Titans in to dungeons scattered throughout the map.  You will need to explore these dungeons and find the runes inside of chests.  

They can also be created in the Molecular Transformer.
Coralium Ore can only be found in Coralium Swamps, Darklands Mountains, and Ocen Biomes.  Of coures they can also be found in the Abysallcrft dimension.
Flight is, as many things, progressive.  Gone are the days when you made a beeline for Jetpacks or Angel Rings.  Then combat and exploration become trivial.
You will still have access to Jetpacks and Angel Rings towards the end game, where they belong.  Until then, Airships and Dragon Mounts are a viable option.

This pack has a number of mods installed that make mobs very challenging.  From scaling health, to extra AI.  In the very early game, you may want to lead them away from your base during blood moons, to distract them from blowing up your expensive machinery.

Consider building a small hut out of reinforced stone, about 6 chunks away from your base.  Have windows around the side for hitting mobs.  Race here when a blood moon is incoming, and prepare for battle.
